title: kMod
content: Just to let you know, I and kMod are both back! However, grafix has decided not to continue with the project, so it's just me. A tech demo will be coming soon...

title: Re: kMod
content: this is not about kMod... please chose a different server for your user image file, 'cos the current one asks me to enter a password to see it! thanks![hr]The human brain is not user-friendly...

title: Re: kMod
content:
Well, that's nice to hear.. *tries to remember* A level editor, IIRC.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: kMod
content:
Oops, got that fixed.

Edit: Maybe not...

Edit Again: There we go.

title: Re: kMod
content: What Is This KMod? What is this about? whats going on here?

title: Re: kMod
content:
Congratulations.

kMod is an (in-progress) all-in-one CK editor (not just a level editor). Which reminds me, does anybody know if it is legal to incorporate ModKeen's source in to this?

title: MODME!
content:
Of course, as long as you acknowledge Andy as some kind of deity. Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

A concerned member of the Preservation of Endangered Spleens Society

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: Re:
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Of course, as long as you acknowledge Andy as some kind of deity.[hr][/quote]
I'm going to have to be doing a lot of that since 60% of the code will be done by other people; I'm just going to do the level editing myself and package this all together in one nice and neat application... Or is that illegal to do?

title: Re: Re:
content: I don't see why not, as long as you release the source code.

title: Re: Re:
content:
Well, of course. It's hard to get around not releasing the source nowadays...

...and I just realized I only have the Working Model Edition of VB6, so I'll release a CNC-made pre-Alpha version until I get a compiler.

title: Re: Re:
content:
Email me the code and I'll compile it for you. (That is, when I find my copy of VB)

EDIT: I do have a Windows machine, but not one I have regular access to.

title: Re: Re:
content: I thought you said you no longer had Windows. But if you can do that, THANK YOU!!!!!!!!!
